channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: JPMorgan renames DEI program ‘DOI’ following political backlash
item.description: JPMorgan Chase is changing the name of its diversity, equity, and inclusion program at a time when DEI has been attacked by President Trump’s administ...

item.title: ‘Severance’ Season 2 Finale: Mark vs. Mark
item.description: The season ended with a bizarre but moving episode that found the Lumon employees’ inner and outer selves at cross purposes.

item.title: Israel Tries to Pressure Hamas to Free More Hostages
item.description: Israel’s defense minister said it was preparing to seize more territory in Gaza and intensify attacks unless the Palestinian group freed more of the d...

item.title: Supreme Court Justice Amy Coney Barrett was reportedly paid $2 million for her new book coming this year, including a $425,000 advance
item.description: Barrett, 53, is the youngest member of the Supreme Court.

item.title: DOGE’s plans for social security are back door way to cut payments, experts and former official warn: ‘This is the most serious threat I’ve ever seen to it’
item.description: Elon Musk's government efficiency team, DOGE, is taking aim at Social Security, claiming fraud while pushing controversial changes.

item.title: Top candidates are avoiding the CEO role. Here’s how to make the gig worth taking
item.description: The chief executive role has lost its luster despite hefty compensation packages.

item.title: Musk tells Tesla employees hang on to stock after 50% plunge
item.description: Elon Musk sought to reassure Tesla employees after the carmaker’s shares plunged more than 50% in just three months.

item.title: ‘It Sounds Strange, Doesn’t It?’ Trump Muses About Gutting the Education Dept.
item.description: President Trump signed the executive order in the East Room of the White House, which was packed with jittery children.

item.title: Live Updates: Travelers Stranded After Power Outage Closes London’s Heathrow Airport
item.description: A giant fire near one of the world’s busiest airports knocked out power, and the cause was under investigation. Hundreds of flights were canceled or r...

item.title: Israel Tries to Pressure Hamas to Free More Hostages
item.description: Israel’s defense minister said it was preparing to seize more territory in Gaza and intensify attacks unless the Palestinian group freed more of the d...

item.title: How ‘Severance’ Uses Old Tricks to Make Its Office Hell
item.description: Clocks, elevators and cubicles become dystopian signifiers in the television show, which invokes and inverts workplace cinema.

item.title: Hugues Oyarzabal, Surfing Star Who Rode With a Camera, Dies at 39
item.description: With a video recorder affixed to his board or clamped to his teeth, he took viewers along for the ride, often inside the curling “barrel” of a wave.

item.title: Heathrow Closure: What Are Your Rights If Your Flight Is Delayed or Canceled?
item.description: Around 220,000 passengers were expected to travel through London’s Heathrow Airport on Friday. The airport’s closure is expected to have ripple effect...

item.title: Long-Lost Klimt Portrays African Prince
item.description: The gallery selling the work, which resurfaced at the TEFAF Maastricht art fair, says a major museum is negotiating to buy it.

item.title: Sudan’s Army Retakes the Presidential Palace in Khartoum
item.description: Two years into a civil war, troops recaptured the palace in Khartoum, routing a paramilitary foe. Civilians have been trapped in the middle in a city ...
